Testing¶

CommonAssertionUtils¶

class CommonAssertionUtils¶

Bases: object

Utilities for use when asserting data within tests. However, they can be used outside tests.

static are_equal(value_one: Any, value_two: Any, message: str = '') → bool¶

Assert the two values are equal to each other.

If the values are both collections, then the values contained within will be asserted to be equal. note:: The order of the values in each collection is asserted.

Parameters

  • value_one – The first value.

  • value_two – The second value.

  • message – A custom message to include when the assertion fails.

Returns

True if the assertion succeeds.

:exception AssertionError when the assertion fails.

static are_similar(value_one: Any, value_two: Any, message: str = '') → bool¶

Assert the two values are similar.

If the values are both collections, then the values contained within will be asserted to be similar. note:: The order of the values in each collection is ignored.

Parameters

  • value_one – The first value.

  • value_two – The second value.

  • message – A custom message to include when the assertion fails.

Returns

True if the assertion succeeds.

:exception AssertionError when the assertion fails.

static contains(collection: Union[Tuple[Any], List[Any]], value: Any, message: str = '') → bool¶

Assert the value is contained within the collection

Parameters

  • collection – The collection being checked.

  • value – The value being located.

  • message – A custom message to include when the assertion fails.

Returns

True if the value is contained within the collection.

:exception AssertionError when the assertion fails.

static has_length(value, expected_length: int, message: str = '') → bool¶

Assert a collection has the specified length.

Parameters

  • expected_length – The length expected of the collection.

  • value – The collection being asserted.

  • message – A custom message to include when the assertion fails.

Returns

True if the length matches.

:exception AssertionError when the assertion fails.

static is_false(value: bool, message: str = '') → bool¶

Assert value is False.

Parameters

  • value – The value being asserted.

  • message – A custom message to include when the assertion fails.

Returns

True if the value is False.

:exception AssertionError when the assertion fails.

static is_true(value: bool, message: str = '') → bool¶

Assert value is True.

Parameters

  • value – The value being asserted.

  • message – A custom message to include when the assertion fails.

Returns

True if the value is True.

:exception AssertionError when the assertion fails.

static list_contents_are_same(list_one: Union[Tuple[Any], List[Any]], list_two: Union[Tuple[Any], List[Any]], message: str = '') → bool¶

Assert the values contained within the specified collections are the same. note:: The order of the values in each collection is ignored.

Parameters

  • list_one – The first collection. (Can be any collection type)

  • list_two – The second collection. (Can be any collection type)

  • message – A custom message to include when the assertion fails.

Returns

True if the assertion succeeds.

:exception AssertionError when the assertion fails.

static lists_are_equal(list_one: Union[Tuple[Any], List[Any]], list_two: Union[Tuple[Any], List[Any]], message: str = '') → bool¶

Assert the collections contain exactly the same values. note:: The order of the values in each collection is asserted.

Parameters

  • list_one – The first list. (Can be any collection type)

  • list_two – The second list. (Can be any collection type)

  • message – A custom message to include when the assertion fails.

Returns

True if the assertion succeeds.

:exception AssertionError when the assertion fails.

static throws(callback: Callable[[...], Any], message: str = '') → Exception¶

Assert calling a function will raise an Exception.

Parameters

  • callback – The function to invoke.

  • message – A custom message to include when the assertion fails.

Returns

The exception that was thrown.

CommonTestService¶

class CommonTestService¶

Bases: sims4communitylib.services.common_service.CommonService

Use to register and run python tests.

Test Registration Example:

@CommonTestService.test_class(‘mod_name’) class TestClass:

# Important that it is a static method, you won’t get a cls or self value passed in, so don’t expect one! @staticmethod @CommonTestService.test(1, 1, 2) @CommonTestService.test(2, 1, 3) def example_add_test(one: int, two: int, expected_value: int):

result = one + two CommonAssertionUtils.are_equal(result, expected_value, message=’{} plus {} did not equal {}!’.format(one, two, expected_value))

add_test(test_name: str, test_function: Callable[[...], Any], class_name: str = None)¶

Adds a test with a test name and class name.

Parameters

  • test_name – The name of the test.

  • test_function – The test itself.

  • class_name – The name of the class the test is contained within.

property all_tests¶

Get all tests.

Returns

A dictionary of tests.

get_tests_by_class_name(class_name: str) → List[Any]¶

Retrieve tests by their class name.

Parameters

class_name – The name of the class to locate tests for.

Returns

A list of tests matching the class name.

run_tests(*class_names: str, callback: Callable[[...], Any] = <built-in function print>, **__)¶

Runs the tests of the specified classes.

Parameters

  • class_names – A collection of classes to run tests for.

  • callback – The callback to send string results to.

static test(*args, **kwargs)¶

Decorator to indicate a test. When the test is run, it will be sent the specified arguments and keyword arguments.

Returns

A wrapped function.

static test_class(mod_name: str)¶

Decorator to indicate a test class.

Parameters

mod_name – The name of the mod this test class is contained within.

Returns

A wrapped function.

property total_test_count¶

Get total test count.

Returns

A count of how many tests there are.
